title.value: Statistical Guarantees for Variational Autoencoders using PAC-Bayesian Theory
title.justification: This is the exact title of the paper provided by the user.
title.quote: Statistical Guarantees for Variational Autoencoders using PAC-Bayesian Theory

extractions.description: The paper derives statistical guarantees for Variational Autoencoders (VAEs) using PAC-Bayesian theory. It develops bounds for the reconstruction loss, the Wasserstein distance between input and regenerated distributions, and the Wasserstein distance between input distributions and the VAE's generative model.

type.justification: The paper primarily focuses on deriving theoretical guarantees and bounds for VAEs using PAC-Bayesian theory, rather than conducting empirical experiments.
type.quote: Using PAC-Bayesian theory, this work develops statistical guarantees for VAEs.

name.justification: The paper discusses deriving statistical guarantees for VAEs, which is a topic within the broader field of Machine Learning.
name.quote: Since their inception, Variational Autoencoders (VAEs) have become central in machine learning.

name.justification: The paper focuses on Variational Autoencoders (VAEs), which are a type of deep generative model.
name.quote: Variational Autoencoders (Kingma and Welling, 2014; Rezende et al., 2014)...

name.justification: The paper uses PAC-Bayesian theory to derive statistical guarantees for VAEs.
name.quote: PAC-Bayesian theory (McAllester, 1999; Catoni, 2003) is an influential tool of statistical learning theory...

name.justification: The paper is focused on deriving guarantees for Variational Autoencoders.
name.quote: The objective of this work is to utilize PAC-Bayesian theory to derive statistical guarantees for VAEs.

is_contributed.justification: The Variational Autoencoder (VAE) is not a new model contributed by this paper; it's an existing model that the paper provides guarantees for.
is_contributed.quote: Two of the most important families of generative models are Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs) (Goodfellow et al., 2014) and Variational Autoencoders (Kingma and Welling, 2014; Rezende et al., 2014).

is_executed.justification: The paper focuses on theoretical analysis and does not provide implementation or execution details for the VAE model.
is_executed.quote: Using PAC-Bayesian theory, this work develops statistical guarantees for VAEs.

is_compared.justification: The paper does not compare the performance of VAEs against other models numerically; it provides theoretical guarantees.
is_compared.quote: In this work, we derive theoretical guarantees for variational autoencoders using PAC-Bayesian theory.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The foundational paper for Variational Autoencoders is by Kingma and Welling, 2014.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Variational Autoencoders (Kingma and Welling, 2014; Rezende et al., 2014)
